p: Ouabain ( 96) and bufalin ( 97) ( Fig. 13) can inhibit MERS-CoV entry by blocking clathrin-mediated endocytosis [153]. Dihydrotanshinone ( 98, Fig. 13), a lipophilic compound, showed a decimal reduction at 0.5 μg/mL and excellent antiviral effects at ≥2 μg/mL with a reduction in titer from 6.5 Log to 1.8 Log TCID 50/mL by using a pseudovirus expressing MERS-CoV spike protein [154]. During the biosynthesis of MERS-CoV S protein, the furin inhibitor decanoyl-RVKR-chloromethylketone (dec-RVKR-CMK, 99, Fig. 13) at 75 μM can lead to a decrease of the 85-kDa cleaved product in MERS-CoV S wt and S2′ mutant [155].
